meanings.definition: To nod or move the head up and down in agreement or as a gesture of understanding.
meanings.sent1: He noddled enthusiastically when asked if he wanted dessert.
meanings.sent2: The audience noddled in approval after the speaker's inspiring words.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to noddle along with the music playing on the radio.
meanings.sent4: She noddled along absentmindedly during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The trees noddled in the breeze, as if agreeing with nature's song.
